title: Prospective, Single-arm, Multicenter, Open-label Study to Investigate the Efficacy and Tolerability of the Once Daily (OD) Memantine Treatment
description_brief: The study objective is to evaluate the effects of memantine treatment on communication abilities and other cognitive abilities in moderate to severe DAT patients.
explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests memantine for effects on communication and other cognitive abilities in moderate–to–severe dementia of the Alzheimer type (DAT). Memantine is a small‑molecule, uncompetitive NMDA (N‑methyl‑D‑aspartate) receptor antagonist used to treat symptoms of moderate–to–severe Alzheimer’s disease; it is not a biologic and it is not an amyloid- or tau‑targeting disease‑modifying agent. citeturn0search4turn0search11

Based on the mechanism (NMDA antagonism) and the stated objective (improve communication/cognitive abilities), this fits the defined category 'Cognitive enhancer'. Clinical trial data show memantine produced improvements in communication and cognitive measures in moderate‑to‑severe AD. citeturn0search1turn0search9
